item.title: Double Fine Paid Tribute To Ozzy Osbourne By Giving Away Brutal Legend For 666 Minutes
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

With the passing of Black Sabbath's Ozzy Osbourne, developer Double Fine decided to honor the rock-and-roll legend by making Brutal Legend free on PC for 666 minutes. Osbourne's likeness and voice is seen in the game as The Guardian of Metal, as well as Dadbat.

Double Fine announced the "incredible deal" on BlueSky, which was already over at the time of publication. Offering Brutal Legend for free on Itch.io was done "to honor Ozzy's larger-than-life rock and roll legacy," per the developer's post.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Video Review - Brutal Legend

Osbourne died on July 22, 2025 and performed for the last time with Black Sabbath just weeks earlier at the Back to the Beginning concert in England, according to the New York Times. For over two decades, Ozzy and his wife, Sharon, helped oversee the annual Ozzfest tour. Osbourne also had a successful solo career after leaving Black Sabbath, and he was inducted twice to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

Brutal Legend isn't the only time Osbourne showed up in a popular video game. The musician was also included in Guitar Hero World Tour, in which he'd perform "Crazy Train" and "Mr. Crowley." Osbourne's music has also been featured in notable titles like Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas and the Madden series.

For more, check out GameSpot's original Brutal Legend review.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Has Now Crossed A Major Milestone
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Elden Ring is proving to be a massive hit for From Software and Bandai Namco. It was announced today that Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree has surpassed 10 million units shipped, while Elden Ring Nightreign has now eclipsed 5 million units shipped.

Elden Ring the base game, meanwhile, has sold more than 30 million copies. It was the No. 2 best-selling game in the US for 2022, only eclipsed by Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II.

Elden Ring's new Tarnished Edition for Nintendo Switch 2 is coming this year, bundling together Elden Ring and the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. The Elden Ring universe will further expand with a live-action movie from A24 and director Alex Garland.

In other news, Bandai Namco recently announced a deal with Sony where the PlayStation company bought 16 million shares to take a 2.5% ownership stake in the company.

Elden Ring developer From Software's next game is Duskbloods, an action-RPG for Switch 2 that's set for release in 2026. The Japanese studio may have a second game set for release in 2026 as well. Given the huge success of Elden Ring, it stands to reason that a sequel will come one day, but nothing has been confirmed as of yet.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/elden-ring-nightreign-has-now-crossed-a-major-milestone/1100-6533406/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Code Vein 2 Lets You Explore With A Badass Motorcycle
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Next year, Bandai Namco will return to the post-apocalyptical world of Code Vein, which is overrun by vampire-like Revenants. Code Vein 2 will have an even bigger area to explore than its predecessor. And as revealed in the production video below, players won't have to transverse all of that distance by foot. Instead, they can ride in style with a supernatural motorcycle.

In the video, producer Keita Iizuka explains that the Revenant Hunter's motorcycle isn't actually a motorcycle at all. It's a spell used to manifest a physical vehicle as needed. That means it won't need any conventional fuel or spare parts. However, it's unclear if players will need to provide anything to keep the motorcycle powered.

Iizuka added that when the player is accompanied by a companion character, they will ride on the back of the motorcycle with the Revenant Hunter. The motorcycle itself is being used to promote Code Vein 2 at San Diego Comic-Con this week with a recreation of the game's supernaturally charged vehicle. Fans will be able to take pictures with it there, or catch it at PAX West and New York Comic Con later this year.

Earlier this year, Bandai Namco teased that the story of Code Vein 2 will force the Revenant Hunter to team up with Revenants to face something that threatens to destroy their entire world. The game is also introducing a time-travel element that lets players go back to the past and make changes that affect the world in the present.

Code Vein 2 will hit Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC in 2026.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/code-vein-2-lets-you-explore-with-a-badass-motorcycle/1100-6533404/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: WWE 2K25 Has Arrived On The Switch 2, But Is Missing A Key Component
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

WWE's latest, WWE 2K25, is finally out on Nintendo Switch 2, but it's missing one of the franchise's key elements. For any hardcore wrestling fan, creating--as well as downloading--custom superstars is one of the biggest draws. However, players quickly noticed that the Switch 2 version of the game doesn't have the image-uploader feature.

As frustrating as that is, there's a good reason: WWE 2K25 isnâ€™t compatible with cross-platform community creations. While the latest DLC pack features the late ECW legend New Jack, recent acquisition Penta, and Japanese women's wrestling icon Bull Nakano, players who want to import logos or textures from wrestlers that aren't in the game won't be able to on Switch 2. That means Switch 2 players will be left with the default images featured in the game.

It might not be a dealbreaker for some, but it feels like the game is at a disadvantage if you want the full experience.

This installment of the series makes its return to Nintendo consoles after eight years, with WWE 2K18 being the last. Players might remember, though, that the port of that game is also considered one of the worst of the entire franchise.

2K has implemented some restrictions on the content that can be uploaded, and the game's moderation team is usually quick to remove offending content, be it images or people themselves. However, there are times when things slip through the cracks momentarily, but that's because of the sheer volume of uploads.

In our review, we considered WWE 2K25 to be one of the strongest games in the series, given the massive creation suite, new additional match types, and a deep roster of 300+ current top stars and iconic legends, which even includes NBA legends.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Want A 10-Foot Ant In Your Living Room? Xbox Has An Answer
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

To help promote the upcoming launch of Grounded 2, Microsoft has announced a giant 10-foot red ant plush that one lucky fan can win. As you can see in the image below, the red ant plush is based on the Red Ant Buggy from Grounded 2. A new feature for Grounded 2 is the "Buggy" system, which allows players to ride insects as they traverse the hostile world.

"That's right. We turned the in-game Red Ant Buggy into a real-world, mountable, ultra-soft, totally bonkers gaming plush," Xbox said. "It's part furniture, part Buggy, and all awesome."

To win the plush, you need to follow follow Xbox on X and re-share this post. Alternatively, fans can follow Xbox on Instagram and comment on the post "#Grounded2Sweepstakes."

The sweepstakes period runs now through August 31. Microsoft said the estimated value of the 10-foot red ant plush is $500.

Microsoft added that the massive insect plush will be available to see at Gamescom in Cologne, Germany next month.

Grounded 2 launches on July 29 in Game Preview for Xbox Series X|S and Xbox PC. It'll also be available in early access on Steam and is included with Game Pass Ultimate. The original game came to Switch and PS5, but Grounded 2 has not been announced for Switch 2 or PS5.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/want-a-10-foot-ant-in-your-living-room-xbox-has-an-answer/1100-6533402/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
